cycloneMessage.issuingUnit: NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
cycloneMessage.systemGeoRefPt1: ABOUT 335 MI...535 KM W OF CABO SAN LUCAS MEXICO
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP2 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Tropical Depression Norma Advisory Number 22 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP172017 200 PM PDT Tue Sep 19 2017
...NORMA EXPECTED TO BECOME A REMNANT LOW TONIGHT OR ON WEDNESDAY...
SUMMARY OF 200 PM PDT...2100 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...21.9N 115.0W ABOUT 335 MI...535 KM W OF CABO SAN LUCAS MEXICO MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...35 MPH...55 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...WNW OR 290 DEGREES AT 7 MPH...11 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1006 MB...29.71 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 200 PM PDT (2100 UTC), the center of Tropical Depression Norma was located near latitude 21.9 North, longitude 115.0 West. The depression is moving toward the west-northwest near 7 mph (11 km/h). A west-northwest to northwest motion is expected during the next day or so.
Maximum sustained winds are near 35 mph (55 km/h) with higher gusts. Weakening is forecast, and Norma is expected to degenerate into a remnant low tonight or on Wednesday.
The estimated minimum central pressure is 1006 mb (29.71 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- None.
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 800 PM PDT.
$$ Forecaster Cangialosi
NNNN
